Utilities function¶

Util function around iob (Shogo Ujiie)

This module contains iob util

Example

IOB decoding:

convert_iob_to_dict(['私', 'は', '宇', '宙', '人'], ['O', 'O', 'B-C', 'I-C', 'I-C'])
convert_iob_to_xml(['私', 'は', '宇', '宙', '人'], ['O', 'O', 'B-C', 'I-C', 'I-C'])

IOB encoding:

iobs = convert_xml_to_iob('私は<C value="N">宇宙人</C>', tag_lists=['C'], attr=['value'], tokenizer=list)
print_iob(iobs)
iob_util.util.convert_iob_to_dict(tt, ii)[source]¶

Convert iob to dict

Convert tokens and IOB2 labels to dict format

Parameters

  • tt (List) – token list

  • ii (List) – IOB2 label list

Returns

List of dict. Format = [{‘span’:(start_idx, end_idx), ‘type’: tag, ‘word’: word}]

Return type

List

iob_util.util.convert_iob_to_xml(tokens, iobs)[source]¶

Convert iob to xml

Convert tokens and IOB2 labels to xml format.

Parameters

  • tt (List) – token list

  • ii (List) – IOB2 label list

Returns

Xml output.

Return type

str

iob_util.util.convert_xml_to_iob(sent, tag_list=None, attr=None, tokenizer=<class 'list'>)[source]¶

Convert xml to iob.

Convert xml to IOB2 format. You can limit valid tag and attribute.

Parameters

  • sent (str) – Input xml string.

  • tag_list (List) – List of valid tag.

  • attr (List) – List of valid attribute.

  • tokenizer (callable) – Tokenize function. str->List

Returns

List of (token, IOB2 tag)

Return type

List (tuple)

iob_util.util.load_iob(fn, z=True)[source]¶

Load IOB2 file.

Load IOB2 file.

Parameters

  • fn (str) – File path of IOB2 file.

  • z (bool) – Output format. True means this returns [(token, IOB2)] and False means [token_list, IOB2_list]
